title: Catherine O'Hara from Home Alone and Schitt's Creek dies aged 71 | ABC NEWS
description: Emmy-winning actress Catherine O'Hara has passed away at the age of 71. She was widely recognised for her memorable roles in "Home Alone" and "Schitt's Creek." O'Hara is survived by her husband, Bo Welch, and her two sons, Matthew and Luke. Wenlei Ma, the Culture Editor at the Nightly, reflects on O'Hara's life and legacy. title: Train enthusiasts farewell NSW V-Set passenger train | ABC NEWS
description: Train lovers crowded the V-Set passenger trains on their final journeys from regional New South Wales to Sydney. They will be replaced by the Mariyung Fleet, already in service on the Central Coast and Newcastle lines. The 'Blue Goose' V-Set will be preserved, while the fate of the other 81 retired carriages will be decided by public input. title: Economists predict rate hike next week and possibly in May | ABC NEWS
description: Households are preparing for a possible interest rate increase when the Reserve Bank meets next week, following higher-than-expected inflation data. Economist Nicola Powell says that rising housing costs, particularly electricity prices, have been the largest contributors to annual inflation over the past year. title: Children in Gaza’s makeshift tents are dying from hypothermia | ABC NEWS
description: Palestinian health officials report that ten children have died from hypothermia in Gaza since winter began in December. There are concerns that this number could increase as millions of families struggle to survive in tents and makeshift shelters. title: Former CNN anchor arrested over anti-ICE protest at Minnesota church | ABC NEWS
description: Former CNN anchor Don Lemon has been arrested by US federal agents, charged with conspiring to deprive others of their civil rights and violating the law by allegedly obstructing access to a house of worship. It comes after he live-streamed a demonstration in Minnesota that was protesting President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown. title: NT public schools mandated to sing the national anthem | ABC NEWS
description: Do you know both verses of Advance Australia Fair?  The Northern Territory is the only place in Australia to introduce a government mandate asking all public school students to sing both verses of the national anthem, at all assemblies and special events.  The Country Liberal Party says the policy will restore national pride, which they claim was "watered down" under the previous Territory Labor government.  But the education union isn't sure why the NT government is making this a priority, when teachers are struggling with workloads and safety concerns. title: Rescuers working to save flying foxes SA heatwaves | ABC NEWS
description: Successive heatwaves across South Australia have killed more than 2,500 flying foxes as the animals struggle to deal with the temperatures. Experts say bats have difficulty regulating heat in the same way other mammals do. Rescue groups are banding together to rehabilitate the animals, with some from the state’s south-east being transported to Adelaide.
